DOC.brief_title: Study Changes Skeletal Muscle After Caloric Restriction
DOC.detailed_description: We hypothesize set surgically-induced weight loss decrement select DAGs result improve glucose utilization , alter insulin signal decreased inflammatory response . We propose examine impact molecular DAG specie accumulation glucose utilization , insulin signal inflammation skeletal muscle morbidly obese subject before/after 10 % weight loss facilitate Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass ( RYGB ) . We compare result control , normal weight cohort The detected difference DAG molecular specie , insulin action , inflammatory response normal obese subject ( before/after weight loss ) emphasize pathway coordinately alter consequence adiposity RYGB surgery . The primary endpoint study : Insulin sensitivity ( glucose Rd , insulin level , DAG mass , DAG species amount ) .Secondary endpoint : FFA level , inflammatory cytokine production , insulin signal skeletal muscle .
DOC.criteria: For Normal Weight Subjects : Age 2165 year BMI 21 27 kg/m2 Normal glucose tolerance determine OGTT day screen No family history diabetes For Morbidly Obese Subjects : Age 2165 year BMI 30 65 kg/m2 Scheduled RouxenY gastric bypass Vanderbilt Medical Center Insulin resistant determine OGTT day screen Exclusion Criteria ( subject ) : Clinically significant heart disease Clinically significant hepatic renal disease Pregnancy Breastfeeding Any abnormality would preclude safe completion study Use statins Use thiazide furosemide diuretic , beta blocker , chronic medication know adverse effect glucose tolerance level unless subject stable dose medication past 3 month enter study
